info.title: About the BMR Calculator
info.description: Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) is the amount of energy (calories) your body needs to function while at complete rest. It represents approximately 60-75% of your total daily energy expenditure. This calculator uses three scientifically validated formulas to estimate your BMR.
info.mifflinFormula:
Men: BMR = 10 × weight(kg) + 6.25 × height(cm) - 5 × age + 5
Women: BMR = 10 × weight(kg) + 6.25 × height(cm) - 5 × age - 161
info.harrisFormula:
Men: BMR = 13.397 × weight(kg) + 4.799 × height(cm) - 5.677 × age + 88.362
Women: BMR = 9.247 × weight(kg) + 3.098 × height(cm) - 4.330 × age + 447.593
info.katchFormula:
BMR = 370 + 21.6 × lean body mass(kg)
Lean body mass = weight × (1 - body fat%/100)
info.katchNote: Requires knowing your body fat percentage. More accurate for athletic individuals.
info.limitations: These estimates are general guidelines. Individual metabolic needs can vary based on genetic factors, body composition, medications, and health conditions. Consult with a healthcare professional for a personalized plan.
